account.description: Name of the account to which the Stream belongs.

allowAtomicPublish.description: When true, enables atomic batch publishing.

allowDirect.description: When true, allow higher performance, direct access to get individual messages.

allowMsgCounter.description: When true, enables message counters for the stream.

allowMsgTtl.description: When true, allows header initiated per-message TTLs. If disabled, then the `NATS-TTL` header will be ignored.

allowRollup.description: When true, allows the use of the Nats-Rollup header to replace all contents of a stream, or subject in a stream, with a single new message.

inactiveThreshold.description: The duration of inactivity after which a consumer is considered inactive.

maxAckPending.description: Maximum number of outstanding unacknowledged messages.

creds.description: NATS user credentials for connecting to servers. Please make sure your controller has mounted the creds on this path.

denyDelete.description: When true, restricts the ability to delete messages from a stream via the API. Cannot be changed once set to true.

denyPurge.description: When true, restricts the ability to purge a stream via the API. Cannot be changed once set to true.

discard.description: When a Stream reach it's limits either old messages are deleted or new ones are denied.

discardPerSubject.description: Applies discard policy on a per-subject basis. Requires discard policy 'new' and 'maxMsgs' to be set.

duplicateWindow.description: The duration window to track duplicate messages for.

firstSequence.description: Sequence number from which the Stream will start.

jsDomain.description: The JetStream domain to use for the stream.

maxAge.description: Maximum age of any message in the stream, expressed in Go's time.Duration format. Empty for unlimited.

maxBytes.description: How big the Stream may be, when the combined stream size exceeds this old messages are removed. -1 for unlimited.

maxConsumers.description: How many Consumers can be defined for a given Stream. -1 for unlimited.

maxMsgSize.description: The largest message that will be accepted by the Stream. -1 for unlimited.

maxMsgs.description: How many messages may be in a Stream, oldest messages will be removed if the Stream exceeds this size. -1 for unlimited.

maxMsgsPerSubject.description: The maximum number of messages per subject.

subjectTransforms.description: List of subject transforms for this mirror.

mirrorDirect.description: When true, enables direct access to messages from the origin stream.

name.description: A unique name for the Stream.

nkey.description: NATS user NKey for connecting to servers.

noAck.description: Disables acknowledging messages that are received by the Stream.

persistMode.description: Configures stream persistence settings (async or default).

preventDelete.description: When true, the managed Stream will not be deleted when the resource is deleted.

preventUpdate.description: When true, the managed Stream will not be updated when the resource is updated.

replicas.description: How many replicas to keep for each message.

destination.description: Messages will be additionally published to this subject.

source.description: Messages will be published from this subject to the destination subject.

retention.description: How messages are retained in the Stream, once this is exceeded old messages are removed.

sealed.description: Seal an existing stream so no new messages may be added.

servers.description: A list of servers for creating stream.

subjectTransforms.description: List of subject transforms for this mirror.

storage.description: The storage backend to use for the Stream.

subjectDeleteMarkerTtl.description: Enables and sets a duration for adding server markers for delete, purge and max age limits.

subjectTransform.description: SubjectTransform is for applying a subject transform (to matching messages) when a new message is received.

subjects.description: A list of subjects to consume, supports wildcards.

tls.description: A client's TLS certs and keys.

clientCert.description: A client's cert filepath. Should be mounted.

clientKey.description: A client's key filepath. Should be mounted.

rootCas.description: A list of filepaths to CAs. Should be mounted.

tlsFirst.description: When true, the KV Store will initiate TLS before server INFO.
